comments.text: This is also common on wired fwiw. This is RealMedia again. They know about the issue, but haven't moved on it.
comments.author: bob@bclary.com

comments.raw_text: This is also common on wired fwiw. This is RealMedia again. They know about the issue, but haven't moved on it.

comments.text: It might be a good idea to have a tracking bug about sites that use RealMedia so they can be collected. Other than that, I'm not really sure what to do with these bugs (other than backing out the offending change to cater to sites like Wired).

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #3)

I've been meaning to write a nasty article about this. I'll get my blog fired up and try it out.

Thanks everyone for responding. I added the proper escapes to all the closing tags being placed by the "document.write()" statements and it fixed the problem beautifully. As a paying Realmedia/OAS customer, I will also notify them of the problem. For anyone who cares to know, the problem is in their web gui that automatically writes the javascript code for a flash ad. Ironically enough, that guide only supports IE browsers.... Here's the link for those interested... you'll need to navigate to the flash instructions....

Thanks again!
-Sam
comments.creator: samawright@yahoo.com
comments.author: samawright@yahoo.com
